title: @meddler, Reason's for the Yasuo Nerf?
body: I want a legit reason, the nerf doesn't hurt him super hard, as far as I can tell right now because it is to his E, but I want to know why. E was barely doing enough damage to make it a viable threat at any point in the game, so what is the purpose of this nerf other than to please people who complain about Yasuo without logic.

replies.body: We think Yasuo's too strong and want to hit his early power more than his late, hence a shift of E damage from base to ratio. E's also a spell with really high utility, so can afford to lose some power while still being highly relevant and satisfying. Finally, we'd also like to make Q max a little more attractive, comparatively, as a build (better counterplay against lane opponents, so want a bit more trade off if he's maxing E).

Have you considered targeting certain interactions in his kit rather than just adjusting his numbers?  Personally, some of them just appear to exist to prevent Yasuo players from being punished when they misuse their abilities.

Windwall blocking abilities when cast in the opposite direction:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2OuN3HNCf0c

Ultimate positioning him outside of tower range (0:33 to 1:00)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0YINsRtqipk&feature=youtu.be&list=PLsL7hqZ-1QGQhF_QV2ZyTm0Rp0DrhTuq1&t=33

I agree with the first one, sometimes his windfall blocks more than it should given where it is placed.. the example you used is the most accurate and easiest to see. I have had times when I walked through the windfall and my abilities and autos were being stopped even though it was to my back... basically the "hitbox" is too large width wise. 

However I don't agree with nerfing him in regards to the 2nd video. I think it's acceptable personally.

> However I don't agree with nerfing him in regards to the 2nd video. I think it's acceptable personally.

It is definitely a matter of debate.  It just seems odd that Yasuo's ultimate provides such leniency while similar abilities (i.e. Lee Sin's Q2, Maokai's W, Master Yi's Q) don't.

those are also basic spells, yasuos is his ult. I agree ithat can be frustrating at time, but you gotta try to be unbiased and realize he suspends himself mid air too! so in a 1v1 scenario yes it can feel awful.. but so many times even in a counter gank etc he's up in the air and I'm just getting free hits on him. Essentially most spells either position you in front or behind a target for various reasons. Yasuos being his ult it makes a little more sense that it can do both. Akali use have hers in front, but recently they made it so she dashes through, more or less to help her proc her Q. I can't think of any other examples right now except for maybe shen? who I think goes in front now to act as a shield? could be wrong though, havnt played him much since the awful rework :)

I'm well aware of how the ability functions.

However, I disagree with its current state.

it takes good timing to use it like that, I think that makes it pretty fair. snap timing with more lenient direction, or good direction with less timing, but not both at the same time. 

I also think his ult is hard enough to use, with it needing a special condition to use unlike pretty much every other ult, that the tower thing isn't a big deal. 

making yasuo harder to play for lower elo players or players newer to him just skews balance on him even more, makes him harder to balance overall. he's already a ridiculously difficult champ to learn

being "outplayed" because the enemy's strong abilities have "training wheels" feels like shit. 

I don't think it's a big ask to make Yasuo have to aim. we have a lot of lenient, easy mechanics champions for people to play. 

Mastering a difficult combo feels awesome. Taking away the easy-mode makes reaching mastery 7 all the more rewarding.
yasuo is already an especially difficult champion. you don't need to dial that up from 11 to 13 and make him someone only pro players can use at all.

This nerf will address his power level (considered to be too high), but still won't do anything about the fact that the vast majority of players find him unfun to play against and he will probably get a near-100% ban rate when 10 bans goes live.

Are there any plans to actually address the huge design issues in his kit?

That wasn't the main focus of this nerf but by making his e less attractive, people may start maxing q instead of e, which takes a lot of the outplay potential from yas. Dashing around like a madman will no longer be the way to go.

Even if he no longer gets more than one point in E for most of the game, it still only has a half-second cooldown.
How will the change prevent him from dashing around like a madman? He'll just deal less damage while doing so.

You should play Yasuo and try going around with E rank 1. I don't like Yasuo and even I feel that it takes an eternity to finally be able to dash again.

It's really not fluid at all.
You really underestimate how much impact 0.4 sec CD difference has.

Then wouldn't it be best by making maxing his Q be a more desirable option? 
Therefore making people want to max Q because it's the better choice and not because his other abilities aren't as good.

Let's start with Q:
The base damage on Yasuo's Q doesn't increase all that much per level, a measly 20 damage per rank, and the cooldown decreases based on attack speed, meaning by building your crit and damage, you get some CDR to go along with it.

At level 18, Yasuo only needs a little less than 70% bonus attack speed to reach the lowest cooldown possible on his Q, Phantom Dancer gives more than his attack speed growth total at level 18, meaning that he a fair amount of it's cooldown gone with one item. This brings his Q down to a 22~% CDR, and that's excluding his attack speed growth by the time he gets it.
^ _didn't do exact math here_

So why would I max an ability for 20 extra damage and... yeah... that's it

Don't forget the 175% damage on crits

**TL;DR**, Yasuo gets too much out of his Q at rank 1, therefore has no need to max it first. 

Now his E:
His E is a dash with a low cooldown per dash, but a high cooldown on single target dashing. Honestly this is a genius way of balancing it, as it makes it great in some circumstances, and not so great to just use in others.

But his E, despite this damage nerf, is still strong. Maxing E allows greater mobility, increased mix damage, and integrates well with his Q. Not to mention it works in conjunction with his passive and charges it as distance traveled. Not to mention it's got a lower cooldown allowing for more reliable last hitting, and dodging a skill shot in a trade or fight can make a huge difference in the outcome.

**TL;DR** Maxing his E does more for him than his Q

-------


Perhaps by giving his Q a higher CD at rank 1 then lowering to where it is now by leveling it up would give Yasuo's incentive to put points into it.

His Q is his main damaging tool. and having smaller windows of opportunity may just balance it out well enough that Yasuo players have to choose between mobility and a consistent damage source.

I don't want to see my champion get nerfed into the ground by going at this the wrong way, and I personally believe the problem should be addressed directly at the reason why he doesn't _**need**_ to max Q first.
